intro: Eriocaulon arfakense, commonly known as the Arfak sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Eriocaulaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of New Guinea and is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or wetlands. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets. It is characterized by its dense growth habit and ability to thrive in humid, nutrient-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
